str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A primary verb; to slant or slope, i.e. Incline or recline.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A circle, ring. As if dative case of kuklos; i.e. In a circle, i.e. all around.
A village, country town. From keimai; a hamlet.
And, even, also, namely.
From ago; a field; genitive case, the country; specially, a farm, i.e. Hamlet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
And, even, also, namely.
Provision, nourishment, food. From a compound of epi and a derivative of sitos; a provisioning, i.e. food.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
